Author: Anonymous_fiend
Text: I’ve relapsed too. It’s so invalidating but yes you still have anorexia. You were diagnosed and semi recovered. You were just in remission. Atypical anorexia is more for people who have the symptoms of anorexia but never got severely underweight. That gw is a death weight. People who recover from anorexia and relapse are at a greater risk of death. Stay safe.

Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: A quick google search should return the DSM-5 diagnostic criteria for the currently recognized EDs. There are provisions for ‘anorexia in partial recovery’ or some such. It’s definitely a thing for identity and self-concept to get intertwined with a diagnosis.  I hear you saying you’re not ready for recovery, and I can relate - I just hope some part of you will maybe talk back to that ED voice even if it’s just a little. College is an amazing opportunity to build a life, but at a BMI of 12 many (most?) people will be bedridden or dead.
